comments.body:
This changes the behavior in the following case
```
package a

import b.c

class A { import Foo@@ }

import d.e
```

We want to use `takeWhile` so that we stop at `import b.c` instead of `import d.e`

diffHunk:
@@ -48,13 +59,14 @@ trait AutoImports { this: MetalsGlobal =>
           case Some(pkg)
               if pkg.symbol != rootMirror.EmptyPackage ||
                 pkg.stats.headOption.exists(_.isInstanceOf[Import]) =>
-            val lastImport = pkg.stats
-              .takeWhile(_.isInstanceOf[Import])
+            val lastImportLine = pkg.stats
+              .collect { case imp: Import => imp }

comments.body: is the explicit type annotation here necessary?
Without it I get a type mismatch where it wants a RefTree on the right where it's just a Tree.
ah, I would've assumed it were unnecessary since the entire expression is annotated anyway. Too bad

diffHunk:
@@ -48,18 +54,20 @@ trait AutoImports { this: MetalsGlobal =>
           case Some(pkg)
               if pkg.symbol != rootMirror.EmptyPackage ||
                 pkg.stats.headOption.exists(_.isInstanceOf[Import]) =>
-            val lastImport = pkg.stats
+            val lastImport: (Tree, Boolean) = pkg.stats
               .takeWhile(_.isInstanceOf[Import])
-              .lastOption
-              .getOrElse(pkg.pid)
+              .lastOption // if there are no imports, return true to pad top of import
+              .fold[(Tree, Boolean)]((pkg.pid, true))((tree => (tree, false)))

comments.body:
I would use a pattern here so to avoid the tuple accessors below, which are hard to read

```suggestion
            val (lastImportOrPkg, padTop): (Tree, Boolean) = pkg.stats
```

diffHunk:
@@ -48,18 +54,20 @@ trait AutoImports { this: MetalsGlobal =>
           case Some(pkg)
               if pkg.symbol != rootMirror.EmptyPackage ||
                 pkg.stats.headOption.exists(_.isInstanceOf[Import]) =>
-            val lastImport = pkg.stats
+            val lastImport: (Tree, Boolean) = pkg.stats

comments.body:
Maybe just use separate values for each?
```scala
val lastImport = pkg.stats
              .takeWhile(_.isInstanceOf[Import])
              .lastOption
val noImport = lastImport.isEmpty
val lastImportOrPkg = lastImport.getOrElse(pkg.pid)

```
I suppose that is much easier to read ğŸ‘

           case Some(pkg)
               if pkg.symbol != rootMirror.EmptyPackage ||
                 pkg.stats.headOption.exists(_.isInstanceOf[Import]) =>
-            val lastImport = pkg.stats
+            val lastImport: (Tree, Boolean) = pkg.stats
               .takeWhile(_.isInstanceOf[Import])
-              .lastOption
-              .getOrElse(pkg.pid)
+              .lastOption // if there are no imports, return true to pad top of import
+              .fold[(Tree, Boolean)]((pkg.pid, true))((tree => (tree, false)))
